goals: To become familiar with the word analysis method
To gain a new perspective on English language and etymology
To reflect on the major social and cultural developments in the  history of the English language
To uncover the hidden and often surprising connection between word connections
To associate new words with less familiar ones
To present valuable, up-to-date information on new words and coinages
syllabus:
**Course Description**

This course is about the origins and the structure of English words. It surveys the historical events that define the layers of vocabulary in various stages of the English language and explores the linguistic changes accompanying word formation. In addition, students will study classical roots of English vocabulary. 

**Required Text**

A reader compiled by the instructor

**Course Requirements**

Midterm (30%), Final (35%)

Written reports (20%)

Class participation, incl. presentations (15%)

No make-ups. Late assignments will not be accepted.

**Attendance Policy**

Three unexcused absences will result in a failing grade. If for any reason you cannot attend a class session, please inform the instructor beforehand.

**On Plagiarism and Cheating**

Refer to the NTNU Handbook for policy and disciplinary actions on plagiarism and cheating.
